overview:
## Return Value

An array of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSTextCheckingResult] objects. Each result gives the overall matched range via its [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSTextCheckingResult/range] property, and the range of each individual capture group via its [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSTextCheckingResult/range(at:)] method. The range {`NSNotFound`, 0} is returned if one of the capture groups did not participate in this particular match.

## Discussion

This is a convenience method that calls [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSRegularExpression/enumerateMatches(in:options:range:using:)] passing the appropriate string, options, and range.

# matches(in:options:range:)

**Instance Method**

Returns an array containing all the matches of the regular expression in the string.

## Declaration

```swift
func matches(in string: String, options: NSRegularExpression.MatchingOptions = [], range: NSRange) -> [NSTextCheckingResult]
```

## Parameters

- **string**: The string to search.
- **options**: The matching options to use. See [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSRegularExpression/MatchingOptions] for possible values.
- **range**: The range of the string to search.

## Return Value

An array of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSTextCheckingResult] objects. Each result gives the overall matched range via its [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSTextCheckingResult/range] property, and the range of each individual capture group via its [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSTextCheckingResult/range(at:)] method. The range {`NSNotFound`, 0} is returned if one of the capture groups did not participate in this particular match.

## Discussion

This is a convenience method that calls [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSRegularExpression/enumerateMatches(in:options:range:using:)] passing the appropriate string, options, and range.

## Searching Strings Using Regular Expressions

- **numberOfMatches(in:options:range:)**: Returns the number of matches of the regular expression within the specified range of the string.
- **enumerateMatches(in:options:range:using:)**: Enumerates the string allowing the Block to handle each regular expression match.
- **firstMatch(in:options:range:)**: Returns the first match of the regular expression within the specified range of the string.
- **rangeOfFirstMatch(in:options:range:)**: Returns the range of the first match of the regular expression within the specified range of the string.
